body: The general approach here looks good to me, although I haven't tested it yet.  A few code nits as noted.

So I attempted to check if this code would work with skirmish missions but there is currently no easy way of syncing the settings or bots again. However as currently pushed it does work for replays (allowing you to start at the beginning of the replay) and for all missions tested so far in mod RA,CNC, and D2k
Style fix commits should be squashed away.

Im not really sure how to better squash as with talks to pchote in IRC he said I should split my commits due to changes to PromptConfirmAction. Also some of my work relies on previous work but after these rewrites im not sure how much.

Sorry for confusing you. I saw that the commit messages say "style fix". Generic "style fix" short log descriptions make it harder to review history, so I will mark them for requested changes to keep the short log understandable. Please replace the short log descriptions with clearer descriptions of what the commits do.
atlimit8 What would be the best way to handle that? I am not the person who made that commit nor do I have contact with them.
Do you know how to use `git rebase -i`?
The commits can be rewritten with a rebase; no need to contact the original author(s).
That might be better, I squashed the style changes one
Any update ?
Further Squashed
Works as promised. :white_check_mark:

Found a crash actually while testing, if a mission implements https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Scripting/Global/UserInterfaceGlobal.cs then it will crash whenever you attempt to restart the replay. However restarting the actual missions itself is fine.

Can be observed by trying to restart a replay of Five to one in the RA missions
Problem with GetOrNull has been fixed, a future PR will make the PromptConfirmAction function more generic to allow one message with 1-3 buttons rather than 2 functions.
Previously mentions crash no longer happens after #10304 was merged
Is this what you meant pchote? it looks a little odd now

Yes, that is what I mean.  Dialogs now look fine to me.

One (hopefully) last issue: pressing restart should do the "battle control terminated" notification and fade out instead of immediately jumping to the load screen.
It would also be good if you could rebase this so that we don't need to clear and re-fetch dependencies when testing.

Alright, I rebased for sake of testing and made it so the mission will fade before restarting. I noticed an odd bug while doing this in that if missiles are fired while its fading their trails stay on top of the fade.
Todo Added and fade code finally implemented. I forgot to push it it seems
Rebased to be safe

Do you want to update the author on the last commit before merging?

Edit: You'll also want to try for a less verbose commit message. You know, just slightly shorter :p
Will do, should be home soon
This looks good otherwise, well done. I'll take a final look after you've done the changes.
obrakmann Is that what you wanted?
That should be a little more clear then, im not an expert on that area but tried to make it a little more context sensitive.
Note that `Game.RunAfterDelay(exitDelay, Game.RestartGame)` should work in the above.
Thanks, looks good now. :+1:
[Changelog](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Changelog-%28bleed%29/_compare/35181146a279dc1ee15c2f4ebcf5f7b9a67439b8)
